website_summaries.verdict: Rather than being infused with catnip or requiring pet parents to sprinkle it on, this scratcher comes with a built-in pouch so owners can top up or replace catnip as needed.
pros: Sturdy woven sisal delivers a durable, mess-free scratching surface
Comes with a feather toy for extra entertainment and exercise
Features a nifty catnip pocket for easy refills
Comes with a bag of premium organic catnip
Neutral design with an attractive denim trim works well in any space
cons: Enthusiastic scratchers might manage to pull this one off the door a bit too easily

customer_reviews.title: Tarzan Kitty
customer_reviews.text: Our cat likes this, and it's a nice way of providing more vertical scratching surfaces for her. It is a flexible and doesn't have any structure to it. I personally think this is a good thing. I hung up a harder scratcher previously, and it would bang against the door. She kind of just does a Tarzan swing on the one and dangles when she's attacking the feather. So far, the feather has remained intact, unlike some of her other toys. Would be nice if it was a tad bit longer, but overall, very nice.
customer_reviews.author: AnneOfLyon

customer_reviews.title: Now the door won't close
customer_reviews.text: My only real complaint with this item is that it makes it impossible to shut the door when it's hanging on the doorknob .... which kind of defeats the purpose of why we purchased it. Our cat will scratch the crap out of our door every night when we lock him out of our bedroom. If we let him in our bedroom, he jumps around while we're sleeping and knocks everything over. I'm including a picture of the culprit... I honestly wish this scratcher when smack our cat Jefferson on the top of the head every time he tried to scratch something. That would be useful.
customer_reviews.author: Patchouli Moonbeam

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to messy cardboard scratcher.
customer_reviews.text: Took some adjusting for my cat to use this but I think she has finally figured it out. I was tired of cleaning up the mess cardboard kind that needs to be replaced constantly. This doesn't leave any mess behind that I've noticed so far, which is great and makes my life easier. I do wish this stayed on the doorknob a bit better; sometimes my cat pulls it off. But it seems good otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I like the idea. Cat feels so-so about it.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for the extra cat my daughter managed to get. The cat has pretty sharp claws. The cat will use this on occasion, but not as often as I would like. It's a little hard to get the cat nip spread around inside of this thing. I'll put this into the category of I like it in theory. I just wish the cat was a slightly bigger fan of it. Maybe your cat will like it better than mine.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Knack (She Has A Knack For It)

customer_reviews.title: but my cats loved the bonus catnip
customer_reviews.text: This came exactly as expected. It fits over my round door knob perfectly and I don't have issues closing the door with this hanging from the knob. The ribbon and feather toy is totally squished from being packaged flat, but my cats loved the bonus catnip! This is nicely made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too small, flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Cats don’t want to use it, it’s too small, doesn’t stay put even when anchored under furniture. My dog would love to rip it up so I might give it to him since I missed the return window by 2 days. The cats still prefer the couch, ottoman, bed, rug...anything but this flimsy carpet sample.
customer_reviews.author: Juliezamb

customer_reviews.title: Cheesy
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. Cheaply made. Now that I know what sisal is, I'd never buy another product made from it. None of my three cats have any interest in it. I would never have bought it if I'd seen it. Too much trouble to return during these trying times. Like most things on Amazon, overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: DRN

customer_reviews.title: Not all cats will like using this due to the type of rope.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a specific cat but he doesn’t care to use it at all. He doesn’t like the smell of the rope. The other two cats like it, but they don’t need it.
customer_reviews.author: chooooooo

customer_reviews.title: My fur babies love the scratchers
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my fur babies because I noticed they were reaching up on the wall to stretch. I hung them on two doors and they have been using them. It was nice to get catnip in the package which helped with getting them to figure out what they were for.
customer_reviews.author: Txtornado

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, but my cat not a fan
customer_reviews.text: Added catnip to it and hung on a door handle, but my cat didn't care. Quality seems nice though. Just some cats like it more than others I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: i trust this company for their consistent good quality products. This scratching post met my standards which is why I gave it 5 stars. I returned the product because my cat did not have any interest in it but that is not their fault.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: The individual rope lengths weren't even, so the whole ...
customer_reviews.text: The individual rope lengths weren't even, so the whole thing kind of stuck off the wall when hanging. In addition, my kitten wouldn't go near the thing - not sure why but he went out of his way to not have to touch it. Ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Mariya

customer_reviews.title: Saved my chair
customer_reviews.text: I attached this to the chair that she was target ing, with upholstery screws. This move saved new chair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No pocket.
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this a 5-star rating; however there was no pocket on the back for the catnip as indicated in the description and in the instructions that came with the scratcher. So, I just rubbed some nippy on the front instead and will use catnip oil spray as needed.
customer_reviews.author: MARY B KALLEN

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: My cat was scratching the door frame so I thought I’d purchase this. It’s a great idea but it bounces around when they try to scratch it. I put it on the floor and they’ll still use it but I ended up purchasing a scratching post instead.
customer_reviews.author: David Poe

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My cat loved to play with plastic bags I had hung up on my door. She now plays with this I like that catnip comes separate as my cat cant have catnip. It nice it wasnt infused and is an option to use it or not. I like how thick the ropes are.
customer_reviews.author: Abi

customer_reviews.title: Vertical scratchers very happy
customer_reviews.text: Cats love this thing. Has a pocket in the back to put catnip in. Holds up alright. The bottom is totally shredded, but they've been at it for at least a couple months now.
customer_reviews.author: vo1umeone

customer_reviews.title: Good and cat enjoys it
customer_reviews.text: This was great, cat loved it. I wish it was heavier though.
customer_reviews.author: Emeline Rodenas

customer_reviews.title: Complete Fail
customer_reviews.text: Once I put it up on a door knob, the three kittens were interested for about the time it took one of them to rip the feathers off and then play with that for two months. I've never seen them trying to scratch it or anything of the sort.
customer_reviews.author: Prester

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy. Nothing like the ones I bought previously. Very disappointed. Even my very playful kitten doesn't like it. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: collectorfrosty

customer_reviews.title: Nice product but kind of short.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product, but I wish it were a bit longer. My cats seem to prefer sisal, but have used this a bit. It seems pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: fortherelax

customer_reviews.title: I tried
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so my cats would stop scratching at my carpet when I close the door... they still do it. It's probably different for every cat but my cats just aren't that interested in scratching this thing
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Hippopotamus

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these. I have 2 and will probably order more. These are sturdy, provide a scratch area just about anywhere, and protect my house.
customer_reviews.author: S. Graves

customer_reviews.title: Hanging scratcher
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, but my cat ignores it. I still would endorse product. My cat is just weird.
customer_reviews.author: JuliaBee

customer_reviews.title: Meh, needs a better attachment of hanging rope.
customer_reviews.text: Hanging cord was pulled out in less than a day.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but prefer bigger size.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this only 4 stars because I prefer the bigger one that they used to carry. This one is way more narrow and less weight. Please bring back the larger version.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: Cat Doesn’t Care For It
customer_reviews.text: She doesn’t use it, idk why. I’m thinking she just not interested in hanging scratchers.
customer_reviews.author: libramonet

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: My cat is actually scared of it. He won't go near it.
customer_reviews.author: Just Get It

customer_reviews.title: Not for my kitty
customer_reviews.text: My cat has no interest. On the up side, it keeps my bedroom door from closing so he doesn't get locked in my room.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hull

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but cat won’t use
customer_reviews.text: My cat won’t use these, even with catnip, but I guess the scratcher itself is okay? It doesn’t seem poorly made to me or anything, my cat just wont give up on the sofa.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Great for my handicapped cat!
customer_reviews.text: I have a three legged cat and this by far has been the best scratch pad for my handicapable kitty. He loves it, I didn't even have to put cat on up on it. Its also held up very well and it looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: Ferne O.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We have just installed new carpet and sofas. This scratcher is a big hit with our kitties!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: I've had this only for a few months and it's ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this only for a few months and it's been completely destroyed already. The last one I had lasted for almost 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Gothdiva1

customer_reviews.title: Holds up
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for several months and it is holding up great (my cat uses is many times a day). I think it's worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Buchholz

customer_reviews.title: Cat ignored it.
customer_reviews.text: Cat was never interested in it. I put it on the floor, on the door and on the chair she likes to scratch. Ignored it. Waste of time. Quality would have been durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The thick rope on the top makes it difficult to hang on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Willms

customer_reviews.title: Decent door cat scratchers.
customer_reviews.text: These are okay cat scratchers but my big boy seems to get his claws stuck more often than other scratchers I've had. Might be a him thing though. Aside from that there isn't really a place to put the catnip inside other than just kind of dump it in. I left it in the bag and just opened it and put the bag in. I got them on sale so it was a good value for the money. I bought 3 and placed them on doors throughout the house. They use them.
customer_reviews.author: Ohioan

customer_reviews.title: Great on door frames
customer_reviews.text: My cat will follow me from room to room and she likes to claw the door frames while she waits. She sheds the paint off them. I have found that if I tack up the pad onto the door frame she will use it and it looks better than an clawed up frame. She will not use it if I just hang it on a door. I cut the rope off and nail it to the frame with thumb tacks
customer_reviews.author: Angelia Keays

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: As advertised! Nose because I have a big cat and he can really stretch.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Stafford

product_meta.title: Petlinks Hanging Cat Scratchers
product_meta.description: Style:Claws UpPet links Claws Up hanging sisal scratcher includes a 3 gram bag of our potent Pet links Pure Bliss Organic Catnip and can be used on a doorknob or the floor. Your cat won't be able to resist the feather and ribbon toy and the refillable pocket packed with our pure and potent organic catnip. Denim detailing and a jute hanger finishes off the trendy home decor look. Scratching helps cats stretch, tone muscles and even helps alleviate stress. The rough texture of sisal provides a particularly vigorous workout and is an exceptionally durable scratch surface. Sisal also replicates natural surfaces found in nature. . . sure to please the pickiest of paws! Pet links innovative cat scratchers offer various combinations of scratch surfaces and angles to please any cat and redirect natural scratching behavior away from furnishings. Eco Advantages: Scratching surface is made with real sisal, a quick growing natural material. Catnip is organically grown without pesticides or chemicals. Pet links gives pet parents the best of all worlds: innovative products, stylish designs, environmental responsibility, and exceptional value with a variety of toys to meet a cat’s need for play, scratching, wellness, retreat, rest, and fun! Pet links products are designed to meet child safety standards and are backed by our 100% satisfaction . If a customer is dissatisfied with a Pet links product for any reason, we will replace or refund it.
feature_bullets: Hanging sisal scratcher with trendy denim detailing, refillable catnip pocket & Feather ribbon toy can be used on a doorknob or the floor
Woven sisal Mimics natural surfaces found in nature
Includes a 3g bag of our pure & potent Pet links pure bliss organic catnip
Refillable catnip pouch attracts cats to scratch while Feather toy with ribbons entices cats to play
A satisfying scratch solution that redirects natural scratching behavior away from furnishings

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
